main_text:
Cultural Politics
3. Cultural Politics

Taking epistemological behaviorism to heart, Rorty urges, means that
we can no longer construe the authority of science in terms of
ontological claims. Though many disagree, this is not, for Rorty, to
denigrate or weaken the authority of science. Indeed, a prominent
feature of Rorty’s post-metaphysical, post-epistemological
culture, is a thoroughgoing Darwinian naturalism.
